MSE200.name: Materials and Society
MSE200.description: Material capabilities, limitations, and their utilization in the service and advancement of society. Role of materials in our day-to-day lives. Resource and environmental concerns including current material-related issues.

MSE250.name: Materials Science and Engineering
MSE250.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MSE250.description: Structure of metals, ceramics and polymers. Phase diagrams, thermomechanical treatments, physical and mechanical properties, diffusion, microstructure studies, environmental effects.

MSE260.name: Electronic, Magnetic, Thermal, and Optical Properties of Materials
MSE260.description: Processing, structures, and properties of ceramics, polymers, and composites. Electrical, thermal, magnetic and optical properties of materials. Materials selection and design.
MSE260.prerequisite: (MSE 250) and ((PHY 184 or concurrently) or (PHY 184B or concurrently) or (PHY 294H or concurrently) or (LB 274 or concurrently))

MSE310.name: Phase Equilibria in Materials
MSE310.description: Enthalpy. Entropy. Free energy. Phase changes in metal, ceramic, and polymer materials systems. Application to alloying, phase diagram determination, and electrochemistry.
MSE310.prerequisite: (MSE 250) and ((MTH 234 or concurrently) or (MTH 254H or concurrently) or (LB 220 or concurrently))
MSE310.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Materials Science and Engineering Major or in the Materials Science and Engineering Minor.

MSE320.name: Mechanical Properties of Materials
MSE320.description: Mechanical behavior of metals, ceramics, and polymers. Three-dimensional stress-states. Stress, strain, and compliance tensors. Test methods. Elastic, viscoelastic, and plastic deformation. Fracture, fatigue, and creep.
MSE320.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Materials Science and Engineering Major or in the Materials Science and Engineering Minor.

MSE331.name: Materials Characterization Methods I
MSE331.description: Thermal analysis, microindentation techniques, quantitative optical microscopy, effects of alloying on creep deformation, slip systems in ionic crystals, viscoelastic of solids, and polymer rheology.
MSE331.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Materials Science and Engineering Major.

MSE360.name: Fundamentals of Microstructural Design
MSE360.description: Fick’s laws of diffusion. Models of solid state diffusion. Arrhenius plots. Use of non-equilibrium energy storage from solidification, phase changes, and deformation to predict and control microstructural changes and stability during processing in metal, ceramic, and polymer systems.
MSE360.prerequisite: ME 201 or MSE 310 or CHE 321 or PHY 215
MSE360.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials Science or in the Materials Science and Engineering Minor.

MSE370.name: Synthesis and Processing of Materials
MSE370.description: Chemical and physical processing of materials. Powder synthesis and processing, consolidation, casting, microdevice fabrication and surface treatments, corrosion mitigation
MSE370.prerequisite: (ME 201 or PHY 215 or MSE 310 or CHE 321) and MSE 250
MSE370.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials Science or in the Materials Science and Engineering Minor.

MSE381.name: Materials Characterization Methods II
MSE381.description: Characterization of materials by electron microscopy, X-ray diffraction and fluorescence spectroscopy. Fractography, surface analysis, dynamic mechanical analysis, electrical and thermal property measurements.
MSE381.prerequisite: (MSE 260 or concurrently) and (MSE 360 or concurrently) and (MSE 370 or concurrently)
MSE381.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Materials Science and Engineering Major.

MSE410.name: Materials Foundations for Energy Applications
MSE410.description: Survey of materials that enable new energy generation, storage, and distribution technologies; thermoelectric materials, electrochemistry of batteries, semiconductors for solar cells, radiation tolerant materials, processing of biobased fuels, greenhouse gas mitigation approaches
MSE410.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials Science or in the Materials Science and Engineering Minor or approval of department.

MSE425.name: Biomaterials and Biocompatibility
MSE425.description: Materials science of human implants. Design requirements imposed by the human body, and need for bodily protection.
MSE425.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering.

MSE426.name: Introduction to Composite Materials
MSE426.description: Constituents and interfacial bonding. Manufacturing techniques. Microstructure and micromechanics. Theory of anisotropy. Classical laminate theory. Material characterization. Failure and damage. Composite structure design.
MSE426.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the College of Engineering.

MSE460.name: Electronic Structure and Bonding in Materials and Devices
MSE460.description: Relationship between quantum mechanics and material properties. Free electron theory. Energy bands, semiconductors. Dielectrics and ferroelectrics. Dia-, para-, ferro-, and antiferro-magnetism. Superconductivity. Thermal properties.
MSE460.restrictions: Open to seniors or juniors in the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials Science or in the Materials Science and Engineering Minor.

MSE465.name: Design and Application of Engineering Materials
MSE465.restrictions: Open to seniors or graduate students in the College of Engineering or in the Materials Science and Engineering Major or in the Materials Science and Engineering Minor.

MSE466.name: Design and Failure Analysis (W)
MSE466.description: Modes and causes of failure in mechanical components and role of design. Non-destructive evaluation. Legal and economic aspects of materials failure. Student projects.
MSE466.prerequisite: (MSE 320 and MSE 331 and MSE 381) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
MSE466.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Materials Science and Engineering Major.

MSE474.name: Ceramic and Refractory Materials
MSE474.description: Ceramic and glassy materials. High temperature processes. Mechanical and physical properties of technical ceramics.
MSE474.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Materials Science and Engineering Major or in the Materials Science and Engineering Minor.

MSE476.name: Physical Metallurgy of Ferrous and Aluminum Alloys
MSE476.description: Heat treatment and properties of ferrous and aluminum alloys. Casting and solidification. Effects of alloying elements, high strength low alloy steels, hardenability, and case hardening. Joining of materials, such as welding.
MSE476.restrictions: Open to seniors in the Materials Science and Engineering Major or in the Materials Science and Engineering Minor.

MSE477.name: Manufacturing Processes
MSE477.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MSE477.description: Fundamentals of manufacturing processes such as casting, heat treating, particulate processing, forming, machining, joining, and surface processing. Selection of manufacturing processes based on design and materials.
MSE477.restrictions: Open to students in the Applied Engineering Sciences Major or in the Materials Science and Engineering Major or in the Mechanical Engineering Major.

MSE481.name: Spectroscopic and Diffraction Analysis of Materials
MSE481.description: General properties, generation, and detection of x-rays interaction with solids. Crystallography, reciprocal space, diffraction analysis, and techniques. Single crystal methods. Stereographic projection. X-ray microanalysis.
MSE481.prerequisite: PHY 184 or PHY 184B or PHY 234B or PHY 294H or LB 274
MSE481.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors in the Materials Science and Engineering Major or in the Materials Science and Engineering Minor.

MSE490.name: Independent Study
MSE490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MSE490.restrictions: Open to seniors. Approval of department.

MSE491.name: Selected Topics
MSE491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MSE491.description: Topics of current interest in materials science or engineering.
MSE491.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials Science or in the College of Engineering.

MSE499.name: Senior Research and Design Project (W)
MSE499.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MSE499.description: Design and analysis to solve materials and/or mechanics related problem. Preparation of written report, oral presentation, and defense of the project.
MSE499.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I writing requirement.
MSE499.restrictions: Open to students in the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials Science or in the Materials Science and Engineering Major. Approval of department.

MSE801.name: Foundations of Materials Science and Engineering
MSE801.description: Structure-Property-Processing-Performance interrelationship of metals, ceramics and polymers. Phase diagrams, thermomechanical treatments, physical and mechanical properties, processing, diffusion, microstructure studies, environmental effects.

MSE802.name: Research Methods
MSE802.description: Skills required for graduate research. Critically reviewing the literature, defining a fundamental research problem, effective oral and written technical presentations.
MSE802.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials Science.

MSE810.name: Materials for Energy Applications
MSE810.description: Enabling science and technology for new energy generation materials, storage, and distribution technologies; thermoelectric materials, electrochemistry of batteries, semiconductors for solar cells, radiation tolerant materials, processing of biobased fuels, greenhouse gas mitigation approaches
MSE810.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials Science.

MSE851.name: Thermodynamics of Solids
MSE851.description: Use of Jacobians. Thermodynamic functions. Thermodynamics of solid-solid phase transformation. Thermoelastic solids, rubber elasticity, and stressed solids. Surfaces and interfaces, point defects in solids. Thermodynamics of solids under high pressure.

MSE855.name: Advanced Rate Theory and Diffusion
MSE855.description: Review of Fick's Laws. Atomistic aspects of diffusion. Defects in solids. Probabilistic basis of random walk. Green's function solutions.

MSE860.name: Advanced Theory of Solids
MSE860.description: Quantum mechanics. Free electron theory. Energy bands, semiconductors. Dielectrics and ferroelectrics. Dia-, para-, ferro-, and antiferro-magnetism. Superconductivity. Thermal properties.

MSE862.name: Dislocation Theory
MSE862.description: Advanced theory of dislocations and other crystal defects in metals, ceramics, aggregates and ordered compounds. Elasticity theory of straight dislocations, dislocation strain energy, mobility, obstacle interactions, reactions, and core effects.

MSE870.name: Electron Microscopy in Materials Science
MSE870.description: Theory of electron diffraction. Electromagnetic lenses. Image formation in transmission electron microscopy. Defect analysis and diffraction contrast.
MSE870.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Materials Science and Engineering major or approval of department.

MSE871.name: Material Surfaces and Interfaces
MSE871.description: Physical and chemical nature of solid surfaces and their interaction with gases, liquids, and other solids. Characterization of surfaces and solid-solid interfaces. Relation of surface and interfacial structure to engineering phenomena.
MSE871.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials Science or Department of Chemistry or School of Packaging.

MSE875.name: Engineering Ceramics
MSE875.description: Physical properties of engineering ceramics. Transport properties of ceramics, especially in ferrites and garnets. Optical ceramic materials.

MSE876.name: Advanced Polymeric Materials
MSE876.description: Advanced topics in polymer structure and properties. Thermoplastics, thermosets, polyblends and elastomers. Processing techniques. Deformation and mechanical properties. Thermal, optical and chemical properties. Composites.

MSE880.name: Computational Materials Science
MSE880.description: Modeling methods and computational techniques for predicting materials properties. Multi-scale simulation in different material classes. Techniques include density functional theory, molecular statics and dynamics, discrete dislocation dynamics, continuum crystal plasticity.
MSE880.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Engineering.

MSE881.name: Advanced Spectroscopy and Diffraction Analysis of Materials
MSE881.description: Physical basis for properties, generation, and detection of x-ray interaction with solids. Crystallography, reciprocal space, diffraction analysis, and techniques. Single crystal methods. Stereographic projection. X-ray microanalysis.
MSE881.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Engineering.

MSE890.name: Independent Study
MSE890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MSE890.description: Individualized reading and research of student's interest.

MSE891.name: Selected Topics
MSE891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MSE891.description: Special topics of current importance in materials science or engineering.

MSE892.name: Seminar
MSE892.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MSE892.description: Presentations of detailed studies of specialized aspects of chemical engineering and materials science.
MSE892.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Chemical Engineering Major or in the Materials Science and Engineering Major.

MSE899.name: Master's Thesis Research
MSE899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

MSE974B.name: High Temperature Deformation and Processing
MSE974B.description: Theoretical and design principles applied to the control of creep, superplasticity, cavitation, recrystallization, and texture changes. Metallic, alloy, intermetallic, ceramic, and composite systems.

MSE990.name: Independent Study
MSE990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

MSE991.name: Selected Topics
MSE991.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MSE991.description: Special advanced topics in materials science and engineering, and mechanics.

MSE992.name: Seminar
MSE992.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
MSE992.description: Presentations of detailed studies of specialized aspects of chemical engineering and materials science.
MSE992.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Chemical Engineering Major or in the Materials Science and Engineering Major.

MSE999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
MSE999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
MSE999.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Chemical Engineering and Materials Science.
